items.title: Unfortunately the math of universal dividends or UBI through taxation simply doesn't work. Compute nationalisation is also likely not a good thing. We...
items.content_html:
Unfortunately the math of universal dividends or UBI through taxation simply doesn't work.

Compute nationalisation is also likely not a good thing.

We modelled lots of approaches & the best was universal AI plus money minted for being humans using it

thelasteconomy . com


Ruben Hassid:‚ÄÇWe should stop trying to save jobs and start figuring out how to redistribute the income generated by compute.

Universal dividends or treating computational resources as public goods become essential.

links.content_html:
Ruben Hassid:‚ÄÇWe should stop trying to save jobs and start figuring out how to redistribute the income generated by compute.

Universal dividends or treating computational resources as public goods become essential.

items.content_html:
My heart goes out to all the families and individuals anxious over their futures following the abrupt and chaotic announcement of H-1B visa changes.

America should be working to attract more skilled talent, not create uncertainly that turns them away. To all legal immigrants and H1-B holders: I support and appreciate you.

items.title: RT ‚øª Andrew Trask: fwiw - this is (more or less) my PhD thesis in a podcast. spent about 8 yrs @UniofOxford compressing what's going on in: - deep le...
items.content_html:
RT‚ÄÇ‚øª Andrew Trask
fwiw - this is (more or less) my PhD thesis in a podcast.

spent about 8 yrs @UniofOxford compressing what's going on in:
- deep learning
- cryptography
- distributed systems

into an alternate view of where AI is going

it's *quite* different from normal AI narratives

i hope you find it üß† stimulating


‚øª Andrew Trask:‚ÄÇIMO ‚Äî Decentralized AI is more than:
- an AI model in the sky, with good external auditing
- an AI model in the sky, which people vote on how to use
- an AI model in the sky, which is free for anyone to use
- open source AI
- federated training

None of these are truly an‚Ä¶

items.title: Very nice analysis by neurosurgeon @slotkinjr of how @Waymo's autonomous vehicles have much better safety properties than human drivers, and what woul...
items.content_html:
Very nice analysis by neurosurgeon @slotkinjr of how @Waymo's autonomous vehicles have much better safety properties than human drivers, and what would happen if everyone in the U.S. drove as safely as a Waymo.

"The national math: If every US vehicle performed like Waymo, we‚Äôd prevent 33,000-39,000 deaths annually and save $0.9-1.25 trillion in societal costs. Even partial adoption at 27% would save ~10,000 lives per year. In terms of magnitude, this would be the equivalent of eliminating every pedestrian death nationally in a year."


Dr. Jon Slotkin:‚ÄÇAs a neurosurgeon I care a lot about road safety.

By now you‚Äôve probably seen @Waymo‚Äôs stunning safety results (like 91% fewer serious crashes). But they didn‚Äôt just publish data headlines. They released the raw CSV files and data dictionaries.
I did a much deeper analysis. A‚Ä¶

items.content_html:
RT‚ÄÇGarry Tan
A $100K H1B annual fee won't bother big tech but it kneecaps startups and bodyshops the same, and that's a mistake.

Early teams can‚Äôt swallow that tax. Bodyshops who abuse H1B should be stopped.

There are ways to do that without entrenching big tech and throttling startups.

items.title: RT Bojan Tunguz: It would be really funny were it not so depressing when nativists use Bell Labs, Manhattan Project, and Moon landing as example of wh...
items.content_html:
RT‚ÄÇBojan Tunguz
It would be really funny were it not so depressing when nativists use Bell Labs, Manhattan Project, and Moon landing as example of what can be achieved *without* immigrant scientists and researchers. Bell Labs was *literally* founded by an immigrant (Alexander Graham Bell), a significant fraction of the Manhattan Project scientists were European refugees fleeing Nazism and Fascism, and of course the entire US space program was founded and run by the German scientist (Von Braun et al) ‚Äúimported‚Äù to the US after WWII.

And yes, the code is public! Learning by latent space prediction has revolutionized vision models, and it will revolutionize LLMs!

Results:

- Outperforms standard LLM‚Ä¶

items.title: RT Êú∫Âô®‰πãÂøÉ JIQIZHIXIN: Interesting! Hai Huang, @ylecun , and @randall_balestr have just proposed LLM-JEPA. It's the first JEPA-style training framewo...
items.content_html:
RT‚ÄÇÊú∫Âô®‰πãÂøÉ JIQIZHIXIN
Interesting! Hai Huang, @ylecun , and @randall_balestr have just proposed LLM-JEPA.

It's the first JEPA-style training framework for language models, bridging the gap between vision‚Äôs embedding-space objectives and NLP‚Äôs generative ones.

Results:

- Outperforms standard LLM objectives on NL-RX, GSM8K, Spider, RottenTomatoes
- Works across Llama3, OpenELM, Gemma2, Olmo
- More robust to overfitting, effective in both pretraining & finetuning

Embedding-space training may be the next big leap for LLMs.

LLM-JEPA: Large Language Models Meet Joint Embedding Predictive Architectures

Paper: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2509.14252v1
Code: https://github.com/rbalestr-lab/llm-jepa (soon?)

items.title: RT Artificial Analysis: Re Stepping back - this release follows the trend of the cost of accessing AI intelligence falling quickly. In the past ~1.5 y...
items.content_html:
RT‚ÄÇArtificial Analysis
Re Stepping back - this release follows the trend of the cost of accessing AI intelligence falling quickly. In the past ~1.5 years, the cost of accessing GPT-4 level intelligence has fallen ~500X and falls have continued as intelligence frontiers have been reached.

items.title: RT Chris Lattner: This post culminates our deep dive into Blackwell's advanced architecture, showing that the OSS Mojoüî• matmul impl is ~6% faster t...
items.content_html:
RT‚ÄÇChris Lattner
This post culminates our deep dive into Blackwell's advanced architecture, showing that the OSS Mojoüî• matmul impl is ~6% faster than the proprietary CUDA cuDNN implementation. The Mojo impl can also be fused and optimized by the MAX graph compiler!

Can you make it go faster?üöÄ


Modular:‚ÄÇPart 4 of "Matrix Multiplication on Blackwell" is here! It continues our epic journey of describing how Modular implemented the fastest B200 matmul in the industry, revealing the techniques to achieve 1772 TFLOPs, exceeding that of the current SOTA.

https://www.modular.com/blog/matrix-multiplication-on-blackwell-part-4---breaking-sota

links.content_html:

https://www.modular.com/blog/matrix-multiplication-on-blackwell-part-4---breaking-sota

items.title: Sure, going through Nature's peer review process means the paper is published 8 months later, but it sure was worth it for the more rigorously scienti...
items.content_html:
Sure, going through Nature's peer review process means the paper is published 8 months later, but it sure was worth it for the more rigorously scientific result.

Right?‚Ä¶


Sauers:‚ÄÇFun fact. The authors originally added ARC-AGI to measure out-of-distribution performance, but a reviewer said they "shouldn‚Äôt follow into the trap of testing the model against benchmarks we don‚Äôt know what they are measuring," so they removed it from the paper

links.content_html: Sauers:‚ÄÇFun fact. The authors originally added ARC-AGI to measure out-of-distribution performance, but a reviewer said they "shouldn‚Äôt follow into the trap of testing the model against benchmarks we don‚Äôt know what they are measuring," so they removed it from the paper

items.title: Jax/Pallas have some pretty fantastic docs nowadays! :O
items.content_html:
Jax/Pallas have some pretty fantastic docs nowadays! :O


Adam Paszke:‚ÄÇ@jeremyphoward We have some Pallas tutorials (https://docs.jax.dev/en/latest/pallas/index.html) and in particular a reference guide for Mosaic GPU (https://docs.jax.dev/en/latest/pallas/gpu/reference.html). It is of course far from being comprehensive, but we're working on it. If you have questions you should also just reach out and we'll help :)

links.content_html: Adam Paszke:‚ÄÇ@jeremyphoward We have some Pallas tutorials (https://docs.jax.dev/en/latest/pallas/index.html) and in particular a reference guide for Mosaic GPU (https://docs.jax.dev/en/latest/pallas/gpu/reference.html). It is of course far from being comprehensive, but we're working on it. If you have questions you should also just reach out and we'll help :)

items.title: RT Eric Gilliam: Zuck sharing some evergreen principles of managing ambitious + applied R&D Having "the smallest group..who can fit the whole thing in...
items.content_html:
RT‚ÄÇEric Gilliam
Zuck sharing some evergreen principles of managing ambitious + applied R&D

Having "the smallest group..who can fit the whole thing in their heads at once," harkens back to BBN's (ARPAnet) belief that big things "get done by small groups..who all know all about the whole project"


Bearly AI:‚ÄÇZuck on his massive AI researcher deals.

Unlike other Meta software roles, he says building LLMs is like a ‚Äúgroup science project‚Äù and best to have ‚Äúthe smallest group of people who can fit the whole thing in their head at once.‚Äù

So, the investment for each hire can be huge.

items.title: RT Georgia Channing: Seeking students & open-source contributors to join some ML-for-science projects at @huggingface. If you're curious about ML √ó b...
items.content_html:
RT‚ÄÇGeorgia Channing
Seeking students & open-source contributors to join some ML-for-science projects at @huggingface.

If you're curious about ML √ó biology or ML √ó materials science, this could be a great way to learn + contribute. I can offer Pro subs, support, and (for longer-term work) recommendation letters.

If you or anyone you know might be interested‚Äîreach out (DMs open).

items.title: RT clem ü§ó: üéâ We just crossed 500,000 public datasets on HF üéâ - there is a new dataset shared every 60 seconds - most datasets are text, image...
items.content_html:
RT‚ÄÇclem ü§ó
üéâ We just crossed 500,000 public datasets on HF üéâ
- there is a new dataset shared every 60 seconds
- most datasets are text, images & audio but there's an increasing number of video, 3D, time-series, biology, chemistry and robotics ones
- 80% are loadable in one line of code and have a dataset viewer on HF
- 65% in Parquet format
- 20,000 datasets are more than 1M rows and 2,000 with more than 100M rows!

Congrats to the team and community, we're just getting started on our journey to become the platform for all AI builders!

items.title: RT Hunyuan: We're thrilled to launch our new Hunyuan3D 3.0! It features 3x higher precision, 1536¬≥ geometric resolution, and 3.6B voxel ultra-HD mode...
items.content_html:
RT‚ÄÇHunyuan
We're thrilled to launch our new Hunyuan3D 3.0! It features 3x higher precision, 1536¬≥ geometric resolution, and 3.6B voxel ultra-HD modeling for stunning detail.üî•üî•üî•

üåüHighlights:
‚úÖCreates faces with lifelike facial contours and natural poses, creating truly realistic, high-fidelity models.
‚úÖPrecisely inteprets input images to reconstruct complex structures using a layered generation strategy, capturing hidden details
‚úÖGenerates ultra-clear, professional-grade details with enhanced texture fidelity and alignment for immersive, true-to-design visuals

Free access via Hunyuan 3D AI Engine (20 generations). Available via Tencent Cloud API. Transform gaming, film, e-commerce, and more!

üëâüèªTry it now: https://3d.hunyuan.tencent.com/

RT‚ÄÇMingchen Zhuge
üîî new ùóîùó¥ùó≤ùóªùòÅ-ùóÆùòÄ-ùóÆ-ùóùùòÇùó±ùó¥ùó≤ paper:

ùóñùóÆùóª ùóîùóú ùóÆùó¥ùó≤ùóªùòÅùòÄ ùó≤ùòÉùóÆùóπùòÇùóÆùòÅùó≤ ùóîùóú ùóÆùó¥ùó≤ùóªùòÅùòÄ ùóÆùòÄ ùó≤ùó≥ùó≥ùó≤ùó∞ùòÅùó∂ùòÉùó≤ùóπùòÜ ùóÆùòÄ ùóµùòÇùó∫ùóÆùóªùòÄ? ùó¨ùó≤ùòÄ, ùòÅùóµùó≤ùòÜ ùó∞ùóÆùóª!

üìÑ http://arxiv.org/abs/2410.10934v1
üë®‚Äçüíª https://github.com/metauto-ai/agent-as-a-judge

Introducing ùóîùó¥ùó≤ùóªùòÅ-ùóÆùòÄ-ùóÆ-ùóùùòÇùó±ùó¥ùó≤, a groundbreaking proof-of-concept that reduces costs and time by 97%, while providing rich, intermediate feedback. It precisely captures the natural step-by-step processes of agentic systems. We also developed ùóóùó≤ùòÉùóîùóú, a new benchmark featuring 55 automated AI development tasks and 365 requirements. Agent-as-a-Judge not only outperforms LLM-as-a-Judge but also closely mirrors human evaluations with greater efficiency and precision.

The real game-changer? It provides reliable reward signals, paving the way for scalable, self-improving agentic systems.

Thanks my Meta/KAUST mentors/peers/collaborators @SchmidhuberAI @tydsh @zechunliu @vikasc @YoungXiong1 @vikasc @Obs01ete @erniecyc @oneDylanAshley ...

items.title: RT J√ºrgen Schmidhuber: In 2016, at an AI conference in NYC, I explained artificial consciousness, world models, predictive coding, and science as dat...
items.content_html:
RT‚ÄÇJ√ºrgen Schmidhuber
In 2016, at an AI conference in NYC, I explained artificial consciousness, world models, predictive coding, and science as data compression in less than 10 minutes. I happened to be in town, walked in without being announced, and ended up on their panel. It was great fun.

Organizer: @davidchalmers42
Distinguished panel members:
@kahneman_daniel
Susan Schneider
@GaryMarcus
Jaan Tallin
Original YouTube video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X9zlvQiGsUE
29:40-39:15

Two relevant pages from the AI Blog:

1990: planning & reinforcement learning with recurrent world models and artificial curiosity. This yields a simple explanation of consciousness and self-awareness: https://people.idsia.ch/~juergen/world-models-planning-curiosity-fki-1990.html

1991: first very deep learning with self-supervised pre-training. A conscious chunker recurrent neural net (RNN) attends to unexpected events that surprise a lower-level subconscious automatiser RNN. The automatiser uses neural network distillation to compress and absorb the formerly conscious insights and behaviours of the chunker, thus making them subconscious: https://people.idsia.ch/~juergen/very-deep-learning-1991.html

Interview:

2016: J. Carmichael. Artificial Intelligence Gained Consciousness in 1991. Why A.I. pioneer J√ºrgen Schmidhuber is convinced the ultimate breakthrough already happened. Inverse, 2016. https://www.inverse.com/article/25521-juergen-schmidhuber-ai-consciousness
